text: "Close Your Eyes" is a song written by Chuck Willis and performed by The Five Keys. It reached #5 on the U.S. R&B; chart in 1955. ==Other charting versions== *The Skyliners released a version of the song as a single in 1961 which reached #105 on the U.S. pop chart. *The Three Degrees released a version of the song as a single in 1965 which reached #126 on the U.S. pop chart. *Peaches & Herb released a version of the song as a single in 1967 which reached #4 on the U.S. R&B; chart and #8 on the U.S. pop chart. Their version ranked #71 on Billboard magazine's Top 100 singles of 1967. *Aaron Neville featuring Linda Ronstadt released a version of the song as a single in 1992 which reached #38 on the U.S. adult contemporary chart and #90 on the Canadian Singles Chart. It was featured on Neville's 1991 album Warm Your Heart. ==Other versions== *Steve and Eydie released a version of the song as a single in 1955, but it did not chart. *Jaye P. Morgan released a version of the song as the B-side to her 1961 single "Catch Me a Kiss". *The Bobbettes released a version of the song as a single in 1963, but it did not chart. *The Dells released a version of the song on their 1968 album There Is. *Houston Person released a version of the song on his 1969 album Goodness! *Earl Lewis and The Channels released a version of the song as the B-side to their 1973 single "Work with Me Annie". *General Kane released a version of the song on their 1987 album Wide Open. ==References== Category:1955 songs Category:1955 singles Category:1961 singles Category:1963 singles Category:1965 singles Category:1967 singles Category:1992 singles Category:Songs written by Chuck Willis Category:The Skyliners songs Category:Swan Records singles Category:Peaches & Herb songs Category:Eydie Gormé songs Category:Steve Lawrence songs Category:Aaron Neville songs Category:Linda Ronstadt songs Category:Capitol Records singles Category:Coral Records singles
title: Close Your Eyes (Chuck Willis song)
